titleStmt.title: The Great case of the justices stated and determined touching their duty of putting the laws in execution, whether dissenters were indulg'd or not, or, A discourse concerning the oath of the justice of peace, explaining the extent of its obligation : being a case universally seasonable, in regard to righteousness, peace, and the prosperity of this nation.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by W.D. and are to be sold by Randal Taylor,

notesStmt.note: Imperfect: tightly bound, with print show-through and loss of text.
Reproduction of original in Bodleian Library.
